title: Understanding Therapeutic Communication
text: Therapeutic communication is a key skill in nursing that involves more than just talking to a patient. It requires active listening, empathy, and the ability to encourage patients to express their thoughts and feelings.

title: Components of Therapeutic Communication
text: Consider the different components that make up therapeutic communication. These include active listening, empathy, and open-ended questions. How do these components help in understanding the patient's needs?

hintAnswer: When a nurse supports, draws out information for an assessment, or provokes deeper understanding on what a client is communicating
title: Defining Therapeutic Communication
text: What is the primary goal of therapeutic communication in a healthcare setting?
choices: To support and understand the patient
